ratings.comment: Im really surprised at how low her rates are. Out of all the professors I've had she was one of the most inspiring. Unconventional, yes, but I learned a lot from her. I think being challenged to learn in different ways and to trust the process is important, and nobody does this better than her. If you let her, she'll change the way see the world.

lectures are unorganized and boring. Feedback i recieved on my papers (which were the majority of the grading) were 1-2 bullet points that were not constructive at all. I wish i didn't take this course.

This is the least representative rate my professor, I would say 90% of students adore professor Layoun. She's unconventional, hilarious, outgoing and has more energy than her students (she was a professor when my mom was a student but you'd never know) - anyways if you don't take her bc of rate my professor, that's a shame.

Professor Layoun's lectures are unconventional but if you trust her and follow, you'll find yourself inspired and changed. If you need lots structure, this may not be the professor for you. But if you want to learn with a truly brilliant woman who cares about you, and more importantly if you're open to being moved, you should take a class with her!

She's a nice and kind woman, but she's very stubborn and not really willing to see other views. If you write exactly what she wants you to (meaning, agreeing with her opinion) you'll do pretty well, but if you try to challenge any of her views, expect to get hit hard. Very unclear grading criterion.

Mary Layoun is a very nice person. Its nice that participation is 30% of grade but lectures are just painful. She will talk about "trying to get people to talk about difficult topics", then turn around and make offensive asides in lecture. TA's grade your 3 papers, and they are really strict. If you're not a lit major, then I wouldn't recommend.

Yes, she's a great human being, but she's arguable the worst professor. She does not stick to the syllabus at all and is the most subjective grader there is. She doesn't allow for any creativity because it goes against her beliefs which I think is counterintuitive to an ethnic studies course. Almost impossible to get an A in unless you are her BFF.

Found Layoun to be hard to follow (goes off on many tangents), but she knows what she's talking about.  Novels are insightful and generally good reads.  No exams in this class, only papers, which is great if you're a strong writer!  Put in a little effort and you'll get an A.  Attendance mandatory.

She was one of the easiest professors I've had so far. Once you know her opinions on the topics of the class (she makes them very clear in lecture) it's really easy to know what to write in your papers to get good grades on them. She can be pretentious, and the lectures are really boring, but always show up, attendance is a big part of your grade.

Fantastic, compelling woman.  I think the students who rate her low do so because Mary raises issues of race and class, and those topics make some people uncomfortable-especially in the direct, thought-provoking way Mary discusses these things.  If you're willing to open your mind, you will learn so much. Mary Layoun is an incredible teacher.

Very bad teacher. Seemed to care little about what students thought and cared little about helping them with any problem they would come to her with. For a class on race and ethnicity, a class where people should b able to be open with their thoughts, she was very narrow-minded in her approach on the topic.

layoun is an interesting person if you have a personal conversation with her, but her lectures are fairly useless. she takes attendance on random days(15% of your grade), so be sure to go. all you need to do is go to lecture and discussion, do the essays, and read all the books EXCEPT for the non-fiction ones, which you never need to account for!

She is the worst professor at the university. In a class about why one ought not to make sweeping generalizations about groups of people, she found it very necessary to do so with regard to her class. She insulted the prior education and viewpoints of the class on a daily basis. She is a hypocrite and a know it all, who doesn't actually know jack.

She's a really nice lady, but a boring teacher.  Lectures lack structure, just a lot of quotes on slides as she jumps from topic to topic.  Slips in political comments irrelevant to the topic (every single lecture and often multiple times per lecture), which is annoying because this is a lit class.

Lectures are completely pointless but sometimes there are in class responses that she takes attendance off of (which is 15% of your grade).  The majority of her class is her reading quotes off of her slides. Very annoying class but assignments are easy

haha, I completely disagree! Prof. Layoun is the best professor I've met at this university!  Yes, her anti-racism lessons may make you think in ways that make some uncomfortable, but God knows Madison could use it! She's shockingly brilliant and the texts she selects are excellent.  Workload is light. Just read & listen well, no need to take notes

Mary Layoun is eccentric, outspoken and intelligent. She genuinely cares about student success and is compassionate about lit. Somewhat repetative in defining concepts, but it only helped. Her lectures are entertaining and thought provoking, easy to listen to. Easy class to read and interpret comic books. Highly recommend this professor!
Professor Layoun is one of those people you either hate or love. There really is no in between. I agree with the other student who called her lectures "thought provoking". Interestin indeed.

I love this woman!  Not afraid to say it how it is and how she want's to.  If you don't take an interest in the material, the class may not be enjoyable, but Mary has a wealth of knowledge and thinks at 1000 miles a minute.  Too many estudiantes tontas take her class, otherwise it would be one of the best classes I've had at this school.

Lectures are useless but random assignments count for 15% of your grade.  Layoun likes to preach ideas that are painfully obvious or that are way too out there.  Lecture consists mostly of putting up passages from the reading and having her read them.  Lots of reading if you actually do it.  easy overall.

One of my favorite classes this semester!!!  Really enjoyed everything that we have read - so interesting.  Lec is unconventional, but thought provoking.  If you don't like to read and analyze texts then do not take this class.  But if you like to read and place literature into a larger context, historically and culturally, then do take this class.

I disagree with almost everyone else. She was kind of out there, but was one of the only professors that could keep me awake. Also, the books were interesting and the TAs (at least mine) graded leniently.

Mary is great. She's a little unothodox, very true, and a little nuts, but she is so passionate about her subject it draws you in. it's a reading intensive course and as a history major it was refreshing to see another side of history that will be learned in this class
Rambles, and has no structure to her lectures.  There is a lot to read and it's really a painful class to take on many levels.
Just watch out, because you will never really know the right concepts or have the right ideas. Things are really abstract.

terrible lectures. she rarely had anything to say and just talked about facism and gays all the time which got really old quickly. her TA for this class were not the easiest graders either - its a bad class

You guys are a little too hard on Professor Layoun.   For anyone considering her classes, she teaches you a whole new way of thinking...it's amazing.   and when people attend herlectures, they learn EVERYTHING that they need to have for the tests.  Never so easy to get a good grade.  quit yur whini

BORING!!! Sitting through her lectures is completely pointless.  I often came out of them feeling dumber than when I'd entered.  Her lectures are unorganized, uninteresting, and not at all useful.  She's a very nice person, but she sucks at teaching.
Incredibly supportive, funny and sweet. Really interested in her students and cares about them and what goes on in the world.

Lectures are the same every time, extremely boring.  Class material was very very expensive, but interesting if you have never read comics before.  She is a nice woman but doesn't seem to have a good grasp on giving lectures.
Wost class ever. Lectures are very unclear and unless you love the toipc you will not find the class intertesting. This class was basically a pain in the ass.
Awesome class.  Lectures can be confusing, but i find them interesting.
Can't help but let her political views affect her teaching, even after students have told her to stay on subject, which is VERY irritating.  Lectures can be all over the place and boring.
